Parameters.Name: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: Correct response
Test.Description: DUT returns GetAccessPointInfoList with one token Data.SimpleItem item with Name="External" is not included in Topic in GetEventPropertiesResponse message

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: Fault on PM
Test.Description: DUT returns GetAccessPointInfoList with one token DUT sends fault on timeout in PullMessage

ExpectedResult.TestSummary: Negative test: DUT sends fault on PullMessage (DUT shall accept timeout=1 min)

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: No wsnt:Message in notification message
Test.Description: DUT returns GetAccessPointInfoList with one token Notification message contains no wsnt:Message elements - NotificationMessage does not correspond to schema

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: More than one NotificationMessage
Test.Description: DUT returns GetAccessPointInfoList with one token DUT sends 2 NotificationMessages on PullMessage request

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: Correct response: Renew during waiting of PM response
Test.Description: Set Subscription timeout to 30s (in TT GUI) Set Operation delay to 120 s DUT sends PullMessages response in 55s. Check that TT seds Renew during waiting of PM response

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: Incorrect response: no event during Operation delay
Test.Description: Set Subscription timeout to 120s (in TT GUI) Set Operation delay to 30 s DUT sends no event during 30 s Check that TT does not send Renew after the first PM response message, check that DUT delete Subscription and failed test

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: Correct response: event was sent during Operation delay at second attempt
Test.Description: Set Subscription timeout to 120s (in TT GUI) Set Operation delay to 120 s DUT sends the first PullMessagesResponse in 55 s without event Check that DUT sends Renew Check that TT sends the second PullMessageRequest

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: Correct response: PM response at first attempt with real delay
Test.Description: DUT returns GetAccessPointInfoList with one token Set Operation Delay to 60 s Set Termination time to 60 s DUT sends PullMessages with event in 30 s

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: Fault on Renew
Test.Description: Set Subscription timeout to 120s (in TT GUI) Set Operation delay to 120 s DUT sends the first PullMessagesResponse in 55 s without event DUT sends fault on Renew

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: No response on PullMessages
Test.Description: Set Subscription timeout to 120 s Set Operation delay to 30 s DUT sends no response on PullMessages Check that TT will delete Subscription

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: Fault on Unsubscribe
Test.Description: DUT sends fault on Unsubscribe. Check that DUT will delete subscription. Test shall be passed.

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: No response on Unsubscribe
Test.Description: DUT sends no response on Unsubscribe. Check that DUT will delete subscription. Test shall be passed.

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: Wrong response: TerminationTime less than CurrentTime+InitialTermination time for CPPS
Test.Description: DUT return Wrong response: TerminationTime less than CurrentTime+InitialTermination time for CreatePullPointSubscription. Set TerminationTime to 60s Test can be passed (because we don't test this behaviour in this test)

ExpectedResult.TestSummary:
ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
STEP 1 - Get Access Control service address Transmit done Receive done http://localhost:19266/onvif/ServicePACS12/PACSService.asmx STEP PASSED
STEP 2 - Check that the DUT returned Access Control service address STEP PASSED
STEP 3 - Get AccessPointInfo list Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 4 - Check that the list of AccessPointInfos is not empty STEP PASSED
STEP 5 - Get Event service address Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 6 - Get Event Properties Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 7 - Check that topic list is not empty STEP PASSED
STEP 8 - Validate topics XML representation STEP PASSED
STEP 9 - Check that the event topic is supported STEP PASSED
STEP 10 - Check that message contains message description STEP PASSED
STEP 11 - Check that the event is correct STEP PASSED
STEP 12 - Check that Topic is correct STEP PASSED
STEP 13 - Create Pull Point Subsciption Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 14 - Check that TerminationTime is specified STEP PASSED
STEP 15 - Validate times TerminationTime < CurrentTime + InitialTerminationTime STEP FAILED
STEP 16 - Check that DUT sent notification messages No notification messages received STEP FAILED
STEP 17 - Delete Subscription Manager Reference to Subscription Manager has not been obtained Wait until Subscription Manager is deleted by timeout STEP PASSED
TEST FAILED

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: Wrong response: TerminationTime less than CurrentTime+InitialTermination time for first Renew
Test.Description: Set Subscription timeout to 60s (in TT GUI) Set Operation delay to 120 s DUT sends the first PullMessagesResponse in 55 s without event DUT sends Renew with TerminationTime less than CurrentTime+InitialTermination time Test can be passed (because we don't test this behaviour in this test)

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: Corect response: UnacceptableTerminationTimeFault on Renew
Test.Description: Set Subscription timeout to 60s (in TT GUI) Set Operation delay to 120 s DUT sends the first PullMessagesResponse in 55 s without event DUT sends UnacceptableTerminationTimeFault on Renew with included acceptable values for InitialTerminationTime

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-1 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: Fault on CPPS (UnacceptableInitialTerminationTimeFault)
Test.Description: DUT does not accept Timeout in CPPS request

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-1 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: Fault on CPPS

Test.TestName: ACCESSCONTROL-6-1-2 ACCESS CONTROL – ACCESS GRANTED WITH CREDENTIAL EVENT
Test.Name: No response on CPPS
Test.Description: DUT sends noo response on CPPS
